g.text: "By introducing the idea of a quality-based learning curve, this paper links the previously disjoint literatures"
"Fewer than 10 percent of the Fortune 1000 had well-developed TQM programs"
"We reconceptualize the technology S-curve not as a technological given but as an envelope of potential outcomes"
"Investors prefer 'killer experiments' but entrepreneurs prefer experiments that are less likely to fail"
"Same coin, two sides. Which side you see depends on who you are."
"The quest for creativity and novelty might actually constrain flexibility"
